adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when a Picker has been dismissed

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when a Picker has been dismissed

apiOperation.shortdesc: Convenience method that adds an event listener for when the picker is dismissed.

apiParam.apiDesc: the event listener function, should take CMPickerEvent as a parameter

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Convenience method that adds an event listener for when the picker is dismissed. This listener will be a weak reference and automatically removed after dispatch.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when a Modal Dialog has been dismissed

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when a Modal Dialog has been dismissed

apiOperation.shortdesc: Convenience method that adds an event listener for when the dialog is dismissed.

apiParam.apiDesc: the event listener function, should take CMDialogEvent as a parameter

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Convenience method that adds an event listener for when the dialog is dismissed. This listener will be a weak reference and automatically removed after dispatch.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when the app is started or resumed in response to a Local Notification

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when the app is started or resumed in response to a Local Notification

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when a Local Notification is received while the app is in the foreground

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when a Local Notification is received while the app is in the foreground

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when the reachability status of the internt has changed

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when the reachability status of the internt has changed

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns whether the given URL can be opened natively on this system

apiParam.apiDesc: the url to check

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns whether the given URL can be opened natively on this system

apiOperation.shortdesc: Cancel any and all pending notifications for this app.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Cancel any and all pending notifications for this app.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Cancels a local notification with the given id.

apiParam.apiDesc: id of the notification to cancel

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Cancels a local notification with the given id.

apiOperation.shortdesc: If a picker is being displayed, cancel and dismiss it.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: If a picker is being displayed, cancel and dismiss it.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Initializes the CoreMobile extension.

apiException.apiDesc: if CoreMobile.create() has already been called.

apiReturn.apiDesc: singleton instance of the CoreMobile object

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Initializes the CoreMobile extension.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns a time in the future, starting from now plus the given parameter, in seconds.

apiReturn.apiDesc: a time stamp in the future by the given seconds

apiParam.apiDesc: how many seconds into the future

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Returns a time in the future, starting from now plus the given parameter, in seconds.
For instance, futureTimeSecounds(CoreMobile.WEEK) will return a time one week from right now, in seconds.
This is useful for passing to the showLocalNotification() function.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Get the current state of device motion (gyroscope) on the current device.

apiReturn.apiDesc: DeviceMotionData object with the device's current motion state.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Get the current state of device motion (gyroscope) on the current device. Before this data will be available, check isDeviceMotionAvailable(), then call startMonitoringDeviceMotion() to start monitoring the device's motion.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Checks whether the current network is CMNetworkType.WIFI, CMNetworkType.MOBILE, or CMNetworkType.NONE

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Checks whether the current network is CMNetworkType.WIFI, CMNetworkType.MOBILE, or CMNetworkType.NONE

apiOperation.shortdesc: Check if device motion (gyroscope data) is supported on the current platform (iOS or Android device with gyroscope present.)

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if device motion data is available on this platform

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Check if device motion (gyroscope data) is supported on the current platform (iOS or Android device with gyroscope present.)

apiOperation.shortdesc: Checks if there is a current internet connection available on the mobile device.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the internet is reachable; false otherwise

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Checks if there is a current internet connection available on the mobile device.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Checks whether the device is currently set up to display notifications when they are received.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if notifications can be displayed on this device

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Checks whether the device is currently set up to display notifications when they are received.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Check if CoreMobile is supported on the current platform (iOS or Android.)

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if CoreMobile supports this platform

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Check if CoreMobile is supported on the current platform (iOS or Android.)

apiOperation.shortdesc: Given a Date object, return its value as a unix time stamp in seconds since the epoch.

apiReturn.apiDesc: seconds since the epoch for the given date

apiParam.apiDesc: the date to convert to seconds since the epoch

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Given a Date object, return its value as a unix time stamp in seconds since the epoch. Useful for finding values to pass to showLocalNotification() when you wish to use an absolute date.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Registers for local notifications on iOS 8+ devices.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Registers for local notifications on iOS 8+ devices. This will present the user with a prompt asking them to allow notifications from your app. If you are targeting iOS 8 and using local notifications, you should call this right after initialization (at the start of your app) to ensure notifications can be delivered in all cases.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Schedule a local notification to occur at a time in the future.

apiParam.apiDesc: a unique integer id for this notificaiton
the date, in seconds, when this notification will occur
title of the notification
message of the notificaiton
optional label for the action button on iOS notifications
optional hash of key value pairs to associate with this notification
optional the number to appear on the iOS badge when notification is received
optional the sound to play on notification. This should be the filename of a wav file added to your application bundle

optional if set, and the target is Android, the notification will be in Android's 'Big Picture' style. If it begins with http or https, the image will be loaded from the network. Otherwise, the value must be the filename of a jpg added to your application bundle

optional if set, and the target is Android, the notification's large icon in the pull down drawer will use this image. If it begins with http or https, the image will be loaded from the network. Otherwise, the value must be the filename of a jpg added to your application bundle

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Schedule a local notification to occur at a time in the future.
The id property should be a unique ID for this notification. You can use this ID to cancel the notificaiton explicitly in the future with the cancelLocalNotification method.
The timeSeconds parameter defines a time, in seconds, when this notification should occur. You can use the futureTimeSeconds method to easily get this value. For instance, CoreMobile.futureTimeSeconds(CoreMobile.WEEK) will return a time one week in the future.
The title and message properties determine the title and message on the notification. The alertLabel property will be used to set the action button on the notification popup. This is only used on iOS, in places such as the lock screen.
The extraData parameter allows you to set an object hash of key value pairs, that you can extract later to optionally attach game specific data to this notification event's extra property.
The optional badgeNumber parameter allows you to set what number will appear on the icon badge when the notification is deployed on iOS.
The optional soundName parameter allows you to set the sound to play with the notification. This must be a wav file that is included in your package contents at the root level.
If the application is running in the foreground when the notification is triggered, CMLocalNotificationEvent.LOCAL_NOTIFICATION_RECEIVED will be dispatched. If the application is not running, or in the background, CMLocalNotificationEvent.RESUMED_FROM_LOCAL_NOTIFICATION will be dispatched after the user clicks the notification and causes the app to open.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Schedule a local notification to occur at a time in the future, then be repeated at a given interval until canceled.

apiParam.apiDesc: a unique integer id for this notificaiton
the date, in seconds, when this notification will occur
the interval, in seconds, at which this notification will be repeated
title of the notification
message of the notificaiton
optional label for the action button on iOS notifications
optional hash of key value pairs to associate with this notification
optional the number to appear on the iOS badge when notification is received
optional the sound to play on notification. This should be the filename of a wav file added to your application bundle

optional if set, and the target is Android, the notification will be in Android's 'Big Picture' style. If it begins with http or https, the image will be loaded from the network. Otherwise, the value must be the filename of a jpg added to your application bundle

optional if set, and the target is Android, the notification's large icon in the pull down drawer will use this image. If it begins with http or https, the image will be loaded from the network. Otherwise, the value must be the filename of a jpg added to your application bundle

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Schedule a local notification to occur at a time in the future, then be repeated at a given interval until canceled.
The id property should be a unique ID for this notification. You can use this ID to cancel the notificaiton explicitly in the future with the cancelLocalNotification method.
The timeSeconds parameter defines a time, in seconds, when this notification should occur. You can use the futureTimeSeconds method to easily get this value. For instance, CoreMobile.futureTimeSeconds(CoreMobile.WEEK) will return a time one week in the future.
The thenEverySeconds parameter defines the interval, in seconds, at which this notification will be repeated. Note that the interval may not be exact- the operating system may round this to a near regular interval, or adjust it to coincide with the appearence of other notifications on a close interval. You should use the constants such as CoreMobile.WEEK to set this interval.
The title and message properties determine the title and message on the notification. The alertLabel property will be used to set the action button on the notification popup. This is only used on iOS, in places such as the lock screen.
The extraData parameter allows you to set an object hash of key value pairs, that you can extract later to optionally attach game specific data to this notification event's extra property.
The optional badgeNumber parameter allows you to set what number will appear on the icon badge when the notification is deployed on iOS.
The optional soundName parameter allows you to set the sound to play with the notification. This must be a wav file that is included in your package contents at the root level.
If the application is running in the foreground when the notification is triggered, CMLocalNotificationEvent.LOCAL_NOTIFICATION_RECEIVED will be dispatched. If the application is not running, or in the background, CMLocalNotificationEvent.RESUMED_FROM_LOCAL_NOTIFICATION will be dispatched after the user clicks the notification and causes the app to open.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Set the theme to use for native UI controls produced by the extension on Android.

apiException.apiDesc: theme property is not a valid CMAndroidTheme constant

apiParam.apiDesc: either CMAndroidTheme.THEME_DARK or CMAndroidTheme.THEME_DARK

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Set the theme to use for native UI controls produced by the extension on Android.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sets the badge number on the Application icon in iOS.

apiParam.apiDesc: the badge number to set

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Sets the badge number on the Application icon in iOS.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Enables Android Verbose Logging mode for the gyroscope reader.

apiParam.apiDesc: whether or not verbose adb logging will be enabled

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Enables Android Verbose Logging mode for the gyroscope reader. Do NOT set this on for a production release.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Show a modal native dialog with a single button.

apiReturn.apiDesc: a CMDialogDispatcher that will dispatch CMDialogEvent when the dialog is closed

apiParam.apiDesc: title of this dialog
message for this dialog
label for this dialog's button

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Show a modal native dialog with a single button.
This function returns a CMDialogDispatcher object. You can listen for an event when the dialog is dismissed by calling .addDismissListener(listener) on the return value. CMDialogDispatcher dispatches an event of the type CMDialogEvent, with the details of the dialog and what the user selected.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Show a modal native dialog that prompts the user to enter a name and password.

apiReturn.apiDesc: a CMDialogDispatcher that will dispatch CMDialogEvent when the dialog is closed

apiParam.apiDesc: title of this dialog
message for this dialog
label for this dialog's button
optionally, the label of a cancel button for this dialog
one of CMInputType.TEXT, CMInputType.EMAIL or CMInputType.NUMBER indicating the keyboard style of the input text box
the max length of the user name field
the max length of the password field

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Show a modal native dialog that prompts the user to enter a name and password. The password field will be displayed as stars.
This function returns a CMDialogDispatcher object. You can listen for an event when the dialog is dismissed by calling .addDismissListener(listener) on the return value. CMDialogDispatcher dispatches an event of the type CMDialogEvent, with the details of the dialog and what the user selected. The event's modalUserName property will contain the name entered by the user, and its modalPassword will contain the password entered.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Show a modal native dialog that prompts the user to enter text.

apiReturn.apiDesc: a CMDialogDispatcher that will dispatch CMDialogEvent when the dialog is closed

apiParam.apiDesc: title of this dialog
message for this dialog
label for this dialog's button
optionally, a hint to the user to prefill the text field
optionally, the label of a cancel button for this dialog
one of CMInputType.TEXT, CMInputType.EMAIL or CMInputType.NUMBER indicating the keyboard style of the input text box
the maximum length of text allowed in the input field

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Show a modal native dialog that prompts the user to enter text.
This function returns a CMDialogDispatcher object. You can listen for an event when the dialog is dismissed by calling .addDismissListener(listener) on the return value. CMDialogDispatcher dispatches an event of the type CMDialogEvent, with the details of the dialog and what the user selected. The event's modalUserInput property will contain the text entered by the user.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Show a modal native dialog with two buttons.

apiReturn.apiDesc: a CMDialogDispatcher that will dispatch CMDialogEvent when the dialog is closed

apiParam.apiDesc: title of this dialog
message for this dialog
label for this dialog's positive button
label for this dialog's negative button

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Show a modal native dialog with two buttons.
This function returns a CMDialogDispatcher object. You can listen for an event when the dialog is dismissed by calling .addDismissListener(listener) on the return value. CMDialogDispatcher dispatches an event of the type CMDialogEvent, with the details of the dialog and what the user selected.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Displays a Picker UI with a list of items to choose from.

apiReturn.apiDesc: a CMPickerDispatcher that will dispatch CMPickerEvent when the dialog is closed

apiParam.apiDesc: the list of strings to populate the picker with
the index of the item to select at start
on iOS, the system's default Done button will be used; on Android, set this to change the label for localization or other purposes
on iOS, thesystems' default Cancel button will be used; on Android, set this to change the label for localization or other purposes
on iOS iPads, the Device Point (not pixel!) location X from which to spawn the popover
on iOS iPads, the Device Point (not pixel!) location Y from which to spawn the popover

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Displays a Picker UI with a list of items to choose from.
This function returns a CMPickerDispatcher object. You can listen for an event when the picker is dismissed by calling .addDismissListener(listener) on the return value. CMPickerDispatcher dispatches an event of the type CMPickerEvent, with the details of the picker and what the user selected.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Start monitoring device motion (gyroscope data) on the current device.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Start monitoring device motion (gyroscope data) on the current device. You should check isDeviceMotionAvailable() first to ensure the current device supports this feature.
While monitoring is enabled, you can read the current device motion state by calling getDeviceMotionData().
To stop monitoring device motion, call stopMonitoringDeviceMotion().

apiOperation.shortdesc: Stop monitoring device motion (gyroscope data) on the current device.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Stop monitoring device motion (gyroscope data) on the current device. Call this after startMonitoringDeviceMotion() when you are finished monitoring device motion.

apiOperation.shortdesc: If the current device has a motor, cause it to vibrate.

apiParam.apiDesc: duration of vibration in seconds. (This is respected on Android only, iOS does not permit the developer to choose this value.)

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: If the current device has a motor, cause it to vibrate.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: One Day, in Seconds (call futureTimeSeconds(CoreMobile.DAY) to get a timestamp one day from now)

apiValue.shortdesc: Two Weeks, in Seconds (call futureTimeSeconds(CoreMobile.TWO_WEEKS) to get a timestamp two weeks from now)

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Two Weeks, in Seconds (call futureTimeSeconds(CoreMobile.TWO_WEEKS) to get a timestamp two weeks from now)

apiValue.shortdesc: One Week, in Seconds (call futureTimeSeconds(CoreMobile.WEEK) to get a timestamp one week from now)

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: One Week, in Seconds (call futureTimeSeconds(CoreMobile.WEEK) to get a timestamp one week from now)

apiValue.shortdesc: Get the current instance of the CoreMobile singleton.

apiException.apiDesc: if CoreMobile.create() has not yet been called.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get the current instance of the CoreMobile singleton.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: DeviceMotionData provides information on the current motion / gyroscope state of the device.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: DeviceMotionData provides information on the current motion / gyroscope state of the device.
